title: Australia for UNHCR
subtitle:
23,700,000 steps. $22,600. What an effort!

During November, you walked, cycled and ran the distance refugees travel to find safety. 

The money you raised will help the refugees you stepped alongside as they flee conflict and persecution. Thank you! #StepWithRefugeespic.twitter.com/fnR0N5Y95q

title: Asad Islam
subtitle: With children in Rohingya Refugee Camp, in the Humanitarian Play Lab (HPL) centre set up by @BRACworld. A situation hard to describe unless someone sees it! Working with BRAC for children and their mothers to improve their livelihood, physical and mental health.pic.twitter.com/U4OmAU9mhW

title: Multiculture Vic
subtitle: With sadness, we offer our heartfelt condolences to the family of Victor Borg AM. As a leader & champion, his altruistic, uncompromising & principled advocacy for the rights of migrants & refugees contributed to the successful multiculturalism Victoria enjoys today. Vale Victor. pic.twitter.com/f3cTzBc1FJ

title: NSW CESE
subtitle: Liverpool West PS supports student engagement and learning through their partnership with @westernsydneyu. Pre-service teachers work with refugee students 4 days a week, building vocabulary, comprehension and their confidence. title: Ben Cameron
subtitle:

 "who the hell is that bunch of refugees "...

"It's the band"

"The band, what the hell do we need a band for?"

title: A Tuk
subtitle:
My name is Nyibol. I am a mother of five. I arrived in Australia as a refugee in 2003.

I started this small business because I want to be independent, provide for my children, support my community and connect to my identity. These all come together to make A Tuk pic.twitter.com/T5KZmTwtuH

title: Australia for UNHCR

Thanks to supporters like our incredible donors, UNHCR can help many children regain their strength. pic.twitter.com/O6I7f8nsuh
